intro: Acinodendron asperrimum, commonly known as the rough acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clustered, small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered with a rough, waxy texture. Acinodendron asperrimum typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
